h5. Summary
Post Function from Third party plugin gets listed before *CREATE ISSUE* post function. This will not allow the issue to get created. 

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# go to *create issue* in the workflow
# add post function from any third party plugin

h5. Expected result
The post function will be listed after *create the issue originally* post function. As what happens when a JIRA post function is added, as shown below
!jirapf.png|thumbnail!

h5. Actual Result
The post function from the third party plugin gets listed before *create the issue originally*

fields.description:
Using JIRA 6.3.11 we encountered the following error when adding timelog-entries:

Using the german profile language, the correct decimal delimiter would be comma (,).
In this scenario, if you create a new worklog with the value "2.5h" (so using the wrong delimiter) JIRA calculates it to "3d 1h".

If, in return, I switch my profile language to English (UK) (correct decimal delimiter being dot (.)) and create a new worklog with the value "2,5h" (again using the wrong delimiter), it also calculates it to "3d 1h".

I do understand that this can be disregarded "user-related error", however I would expect JIRA to at least throw the default "this time format is not supported" error when using the wrong delimiter, as - at least in the german locale - I can't think of an ocassion where you'd want to use dot (for thousands) in this time-field.
Ideally - if this can be guaranteed - there would maybe still be the option to thread both delimiters the same way independent of the selected profile language.

I've attached a screenshot were I show the entries using the English (UK) language for your potential repro-steps.

If you need further info, please feel free to contact me via psendek@adaptavist.com.

Thank you very much!

Regards,
Philipp
fields.summary: Worklogs - Wrong time calculated if using delimiter of another locale

fields.description:
The webhook in JIRA does not contain any information about the attachment if the issue was created using email. However, it does contain the attachment information if the issue was created using UI.

h2. Steps to reproduce.
* Set up a webhook in JIRA for 'Issue Created' event.
* Now create an issue using the JIRA UI in a way that the webhook event will be triggered.
* Notice that in the JSON, there is attachment information present.
* Now create another issue with the same attachment but using through email 
* Notice that in the JSON, there is no attachment information present
* The issue created has the attachment present.


(See attachments)


On a side note : 
If issue is moved from one issuetype to another issue type that is sending information via webhook then also the attachment are not sent. But if those attachments are added after movement then they are sent via webhook.
fields.summary: Jira webhook doesn't send information about attachments when issue is created via email

  {panel}

We often have huge discussion in our issue topics and if theres one comment I dont wish to read as I already know the information, I "fold" that comment so it takes no real space on the screen.
What JIRA should do is, that it saves the state of that comment to my logged in user so when a User re-enters the Issue the comments stays "hidden" (as in "folded") for that user.
That way, he (the user) doesnt have to fold the comment again.

That info (comment X of issue Y for user Z) should be saved in a database so the user can login wherever he want and it stays the same experience. Alternative a cookie could be set regarding this (or make use of the HTML5 storage?)
fields.summary: Ability to remember folded comments

This issue doesnt seem to be new, but heres a few ideas how this can be implemented:

- When an project admin archives a comment the comment will get "greyed out" and/or "folded" so a future reader can read that comment but it isnt necessary (as it contains invalid info or is off-topic or <add another reason here>

We have some comments in our JIRA which tends to go off-topic sometime and we dont want the comments to "interact" with our future selfs.
Or if we have comments which contains invalid information - which could be deleted but its better to simply "shut if off" by archiving the comment.

fields.description:
Its actually a race condition bug in JIRA related to the auto-watch functionality. In all these cases, the notification scheme needs to send messages to watching users on comment.

Case 1:

* User comments on issue they would not get notifications for.
* Autowatch service makes user watch the issue.
* Notification is sent. The user will now get an e-mail because he is watching the issue. 

Case 2:
* User comments on issue they would not get notifications for.
* Notification is sent. The user will *NOT* get an e-mail because he is not a watcher.
* Autowatch service makes user watch the issue.

Both cases are possible depending upon the order in which the Issue Commented event is fired amongst its listeners, in this case the AutoWatchService and MailListener. The order of registration no longer seems to be deterministic between restarts. 

This might be a change in atlassian-events or a change in the way we register listeners in JIRA. In any case we need to fix it.
fields.summary: Autowatch feature can lead to non-deterministic e-mail notifications.

fields.description:
JIRA recently added a "permanent" vertical scrollbar to all pages.

When a Modal Dialog is opened, the page is blanketed and the scrollbar is removed.  When the dialog is dismissed, the scrollbar does not return.

The scrollbar should always be present on pages, even after dialogs are opened and closed.

Reserving the space for the scrollbar or keeping the scrollbar around while a modal is open is out of scope of this bug.
fields.summary: JIRA+AUI Dialog and other modals need to honor the scrollbar styles

When a Modal Dialog is opened, the page is blanketed and the scrollbar is removed.  When the dialog is dismissed, the scrollbar does not return.

The scrollbar should always be present on pages, even after dialogs are opened and closed.

Reserving the space for the scrollbar or keeping the scrollbar around while a modal is open is out of scope of this bug.

fields.description:
Hi, Atlassians,

In particular case, 
when you search issues which don't include exact phrase in their comments, it also returns the issues which include the phrase in comments.

For example, here are the sample issues with comments like this.
    Issue#1: blah blah blah
        comment#1: "the magic spell is DONOTSEARCHIT. OK, it's opened,"
        comment#2: "just updated"
    Issue#2: something something something
        comment#1: "just reloaded"
    Issue#3: 
        no comments

And create a filter like this.
    comment !~ "DONOTSEARCHIT"

I guess it should return Issue#2 and #3, but, you'll get Issue#1 and #2 as the result. 

When I look at #1, the filter evaluates and picks up each comment, not a issue.
When I look at #3, the filter doesn't check issues with no comments.

I'm sorry but I checked only JIRA 6.3.8.

Regards,
fields.summary: Filter by exclusive phrase in comments doesn't return appropreate result.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43599].
  {panel}

I’ve noticed a little bug with Jira, where 24h view shows you more views than past 31 days.

This happens only to Past 31 Days, when you select any other option (12 months or 5 years) it goes back to the same number as it was showing in “last 24h”

I will provide you with screenshots so you can understand the issue better.
 !screenshot-1.png!
!screenshot-2.png!
 !screenshot-3.png!
To replicate this issue, please navigate to https://cmo-compliance.atlassian.net/browse/CI-190  (Happens on all of the issues, but this is just an example where screenshots have been taken)

If you need any more information, then please do not hesitate to contact me.
fields.summary: usage statistics bug
Update 6.4 Stable to bundle Service Desk 2.4.3
Allow administrators to choose which Log Work they want available to users when Tempo Timesheet is enabled
Make the option 'Allow transition from all states' not to create a self-transition

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# click to view an attached image from a View Issue screen
# right click and "Copy image"
# open an MS Word file and Paste

h4. +Expected behavior+
The image is copied to Word and visible

h4. +Actual behavior+
The image is not copied to Word, instead, an empty textbox is pasted:
!word.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Notes+
* This doesn't happen when pasting to MS Paint i.e. the copied image is pasted correctly
* The same behavior is observed using Chrome, Firefox, and IE11
* The same behavior is observed when opening the attached image in a new tab first then performing the same copy/paste steps
fields.summary: Attached Images cannot be copied directly into Microsoft Word

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43592].
  {panel}

As an admin, it would be great if we can configure the users which can/cannot view issue links. This can be done based on groups, or maybe have a permission just for that. A use case scenario would be like the following
# We have 2 Jira instances that have application links
# Jira A is accessible externally the company (customers)
# Jira B is accessible only internally
# There is an issue link between JIRA A & B
# Customers do not have access to JIRAB, so there is not point they can view issue links
fields.summary: Feature to hide issue links based on groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43590].
  {panel}

h4. +Context+
This ticket is created based on JRA-42515, after investigations have been conducted to verify the described behavior. Findings of the investigations:
# (/) *Writing user/group data from JIRA to LDAP is supposed to work properly* provided:
## The LDAP permission type configured in JIRA is Read/Write
## The username used for LDAP configuration has Read/Write privileges to LDAP
# (x) If 1.1 is correct, but 1.2 fails i.e. username without Read/Write privileges, then an unclear/misleading error message might be thrown, making it hard for JIRA admin to troubleshoot the root cause:
{code}
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.GroupNotFoundException: Group <Unable to create group jira-users in directory 10000 in order to add membership of user user@domain.com (group jira-users found in directory 10000)> does not exist
{code}
# (!) This misleading message sounds like the Read/Write permission type of the LDAP directory does not work: unable to add an internal group to the LDAP server in order to add an LDAP user to it.
# (i) The *root cause*: the username used for LDAP configuration does not have Read/Write privileges to LDAP

h4. +Steps to reproduce & Facts+
# connect JIRA to an LDAP server using Connector type with Read/Write permission type
# specify a username without Read/Write privileges
# from User Management -> Users, try adding an LDAP user to an Internal group:
!user_browser.png|thumbnail!
## (!) When adding an LDAP user to an LDAP group, there's no error message, just a quick refresh in the browser, and the user is NOT added to the group.
# from User Management -> Groups, try adding an LDAP user to an Internal group:
!group_browser.png|thumbnail!
# from User Management -> Groups, try adding an LDAP user to an LDAP group:
!ldap_group_group_browser.png|thumbnail!
(/) The error message thrown at this step is *correct*

h4. +Suggestion+
{panel}
# The error message in step 3 and 4 above should be similar to that in step 5, which is correct, relevant, and meaningful.
# Also, the same message should be thrown for step 3.1.
{panel}
fields.summary: Improve Error Message when LDAP Write Fails due to Lack of User Privileges
Make Mentions use the IssueEvent pattern

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43585].
  {panel}

*Problem-Context*

Some of my customers are highly concerned about securing JIRA/Confluence. While accesing the tools can be easily secured through SSL a security painpont are the notfication mails. Enabling TLS for the mail server is useless in most scenarios as this only secures the transport to the next hop. 

So how to deal with it. The first strategy is to customize the mail templates and strip all content that is not allowed to be deliverd through insecure networks. There are some tickets in JIRA and confluence about this matter. However customizing the templates is to much administration as this needs to check after each update/upgrade of the tool. In addition the users really love the notifications, and stripping all content is not of much help to them.

The second strategy applies to a scenario where mails to some domains could be delivered without any concern (e.g. secure internal domain) and some mails to external suppliers needs to be dropped or filtered. In this case I recommend my customers to setup an postfix after queue filter to do the trick - which works pretty well.

*Suggestion*

There should be a flag in the notification scheme which says "Send mails to the user only if he or she has provided a valid mail certificate". In the user profile there would be an upload feature, so that the user can upload or update his public mail certificate (as selfservice - so no additional administration efforts in caretaking of certificates). And of course if the flag is set, the mail sent would be encrypted and signed by JIRA/Confluence and if the user has not stored a certificate he gets nothing (or an advice to store a mail certificate in his profile).
fields.summary: Enabling encrypted mail notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users are able to create/comment issues via email without group membership if they are added directly to the project's permission.
User shouldn't be able to do that since he can't access the application itself.

Same applies to JIRA's notifications.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove user from all groups
# Add user directly to the project's "Browse Projects" and "Create Issues" permissions
# Send an email to JIRA form the user/trigger notification to user from JIRA

h3. Expected Results
User doesn't create issues/receive notification since he can't log into JIRA

h3. Actual Results
User successfully creates issues and receives notifications from JIRA

JIRA 6.4.2 / Service Desk 2.4.2 / Firefox 38.0

Create new service desk project (probably happens on an existing project unrelated to service desk as well)

!issueCollectorHelpBoxWithBrokenLink.png!

Click the 'Fields' link in the box and get a 404 page like the attached:
!itsdeadJim404.png!

On our JIRA the Fields link pointed to:

https://jiraserver.company.com/secure/%22/plugins/servlet/project-config/TTD/fields%22

-wc

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43561].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
If a workflow has an integrity problem, assigning it to a workflow scheme to be used by a project will make this a dead-end:
* the corrupted workflow does not work properly because of itself e.g. missing workflow buttons
* there's no way to switch to a different scheme or assigning a different workflow to replace the corrupted one because of publishing/associating failure:
{noformat}
Technical details
Log's referral number: 7ff20bca-f7b0-46f2-8bc8-82a1c69ddf74
Cause
Referer URL: http://10.60.5.148:8644/secure/project/SelectProjectWorkflowSchemeStep2!default.jspa?draftMigration=true&schemeId=10002

{noformat}

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# export a working workflow to XML e.g. Classic Default Workflow
# open the XML file and look for an entry like this:
{code}<step id="1" name="Open">
      <meta name="jira.status.id">1</meta>{code}
# remove the meta value, so it becomes:
{code}<step id="1" name="Open">
      <meta name="jira.status.id"></meta>{code}
# save the XML file and import it into JIRA with a unique name
# open the imported workflow and notice that step Open has NO linked Status:
!corrupt.png|thumbnail!
# simply assign it to a workflow scheme used by a project, so that both the workflow and workflow scheme are *active*
# create a new issue in the project that will use this corrupted workflow
# attempt to switch the project's workflow scheme or assign a new workflow to the scheme and publish it
-> 500 Error Page

h4. +Suggestion+
{panel}Since customers might rely on XML to prepare and import workflows, which are susceptible to errors, there should be a validation step when adding a workflow to a workflow scheme that should be able to detect whether the to-be-added workflow has an integrity problem or not, so that a dead-end like described above won't happen.{panel}

h4. +Note+
Currently when adding a corrupted workflow like described above, this kind of diagram is seen, which is not clear whether it has an integrity problem in it:
!classic.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Workaround+
# From the UI, make a copy of the corrupted workflow and edit it properly
# (!) Take an XML backup of JIRA if necessary
# Shut down JIRA
# (!) Take an SQL backup of the database if necessary
# Run this SQL query to identify the relationship between project, workflow, and issue type (replace DUMMY with the respective project key of the project with the corrupted workflow):
{code}SELECT 
    p.pname as 'Project Name',
    p.pkey as 'Project Key',
    wse.id as 'Entity ID',
    wse.scheme as 'Workflow Scheme ID',
    ws.name as 'Workflow Scheme Name',
    wse.workflow as 'Workflow Name',
    wse.issuetype as 'Issue Type'
FROM
    workflowschemeentity wse inner join workflowscheme ws on wse.scheme = ws.id
    inner join nodeassociation na on ws.id = na.sink_node_id
    inner join project p on p.id = na.source_node_id
WHERE
    p.pkey = 'DUMMY' and na.sink_node_entity = 'WorkflowScheme';{code}
(i) Sample result:
|Project Name	|Project Key	|Entity ID	|Workflow Scheme ID	|Workflow Scheme Name	|Workflow Name	|Issue Type|
|Dummy Project	|DUMMY	|10900	|10700	|Dummy Workflow Scheme	|Dummy Workflow	|0|
{panel}
(/) In this example, Dummy Workflow is the corrupted workflow. The workaround is to associate the copied/edited workflow of Dummy Workflow to Dummy Workflow Scheme via an SQL query. Take note of the Entity ID above, which is 10900 in this example.
(!) There may be more rows returned, in case the project uses multiple workflows for multiple issue types, so just take note of the Entity ID of the corrupted workflow in your case.
{panel}
# Let's say the copied/edited workflow (in step 1) is named 'Edited Dummy Workflow', run this SQL query to make sure it exists in the database:
{code}SELECT id, workflowname FROM jiraworkflows WHERE workflowname = 'Edited Dummy Workflow';{code}
# If it exists, then run this SQL query to associate it to Dummy Workflow Scheme as discussed above:
{code}
UPDATE workflowschemeentity SET workflow = 'Edited Dummy Workflow' WHERE id = 10900;
{code}
(i) replace 10900 with the Entity ID identified in your case
# Restart JIRA
(/) project DUMMY should be using Edited Dummy Workflow instead of Dummy Workflow now, which is possible to be edited if necessary.
fields.summary: Validate workflow integrity before allowing addition to workflow scheme

fields.description:
Create 2 JIRA classic scheme projects and 1 JIRA Agile project and consider below 3 cases:

#1. When, using Top Nav Project drop down list I switch between two of mine JIRA classic projects, ProjectKey/Id is refreshed in my hyperlinks. Please refer to screenshot "Links with JIRA classic projects.png"

#2. But when I switch from a JIRA classic project to JIRA Agile project, ProjectKey/Id is not updated in my hyperlinks. Please refer to screenshot "Links with JIRA Agile project wrong project key.png".

#3. After selecting agile project, if I refresh the screen, I can see the right ProjectKey/Id in my links.
Please refer to screenshot "Links with JIRA Agile project right project key.png".

Essentially, while I switch between non-agile projects these links are updated with selected ProjectKey/Id. But when I switch from a non-agile project to an agile project, ProjectKey/Id is not updated until I refresh the screen.
fields.summary: Switching project to "Agile Project" doesn't refresh/update the links (wrt project key and id)
